comment: Not the best of teachers, would not recommend taking her class. Often tested in material not reviewed in any of the lectures and even lost my papers a couple of times.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: she just moaned all class
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Never used the online textbook. Not once. A writing tutor will make this a slam dunk.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: dr blanchard is the most interesting teacher. i have her for my h lit class and she definitely is a character. she talks to herself sometimes but thats ok. um she doesnt like late work. kinda cool tho:)

She was an amazing teacher. For me, I had her during online learning and she accommodated for that. I wasn't 100% sure about any of my papers but always received an A. She answered all of my questions during class but slow to reply to email. Each essay had the same topic and they tied together which was more helpful to understand the papers
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: We had one major paper due at the end of the semester and other papers due throughout the semester that built up to the final paper. The final paper was the only thing she was a harsh grader on. Everything else like the annotated bib, source analysis, and outline seemed to be easy A's. Discussion posts due every week but were an easy grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a good professor but is very clear about what she wants and expects you meet it. Wasn't too hard, she made it to where it wasn't boring. There was two or three group projects but again not hard. I was in the hybrid class so showing up was needed in order to keep up and do good. She does give you extra points if you only miss 1 class or none.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: Ms. Blanchard is a great teacher. I took her Hybrid class so we only met once a week, but she would always send updates to the class through email. The papers and projects werent hard but rather tedious and she is a hard grader but for good reason. There was also a discussion post that would be due every other Thursday but overall great course!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The material is typical for a class in literature. There are literary tools she emphasizes throughout the course. In regards to her dictation to the class, they're are plenty of uncomfortable silences. She gets noticeable annoyed when no one responds to her. That moodiness can come off as apparent when asked questions by other students.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Awesome professor. She was very cordial. Worked with you if you had a good reasoning. Kept the students engaged with fun anecdotes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: In my six semesters at KSU she still is my favorite Prof. She gives great feedback on essays and will gladly help you if you are willing to work hard. Myself and 2 of my friends all took her class for ENG 1101 and 1102 and we all loved her. She even lets you pick your own topic for essays. Fantastic teacher and a great learning experience.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: i would recommend this professor 100%
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: lost my paper multiple times. Her response to losing my paper was " sorry, redo it" I tried to ask her for help but never got any. I tried harder than any class I have ever taken and still got a B.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I barely read our text book and made an A, her tests are exactly the lectures so as long as your take some notes and read over her power points your going to make a good grade
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I enjoyed having Professor Blanchard as an english professor. She helped me improve my writing and I will take that with me into future classes. she starts out assigning small papers and gradually builds up to a longer paper at the end of the semester. Her expectations are fair and she is very clear with instructions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: By far the best English professor I have ever had. I skipped 1101 and went straight to 1102 and Dr. B made the transition so smooth and easy. You do write 5 papers with a group project, but she lets you turn in your paper before the due date and then lets you fix any big errors before you have to turn it in for good.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Willing to help and gives revisions on all papers. Strongly advice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Blanchard is a good professor. I hate writing and she helped me improve my writing a lot. She focuses a lot on MLA format which is easy. Strongly recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Awesome. Do the papers, fix what she tells you when she lets you revise and ask questions. Would take this class for sure
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you failed this class, you didn't put in the effort and probably deserved it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr B is my favorite professor. She is so ready to help students in whatever way she can. Strongly urge you take her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr Blanchard is the professor who made me realize I want to teach English. She is so caring, so willing to help, and so kind. I strongly suggest taking this English course!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Dr Blanchard is an amazing professor. As she says, she could not be any more emotionally involved with our grade than we are. That being said, she gives many chances for you to make an easy A in the class. Its simply up to the students willingness to do assignments on time and listen to what she has to say. Wonderful class. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I haven't been in school for 5 years and was very scared about English. Dr. Blanchard is an amazing professor she seems tough but every assignment she grades it and then she lets you correct your paper for up to 10% more points on each essay. 4 1 page papers and 2 5 page papers the whole class very easy definitely should take her to learn writing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: At first I was nervous but I ended up doing well in the class. I hate writing, but if you just do the assigned work then you will pass. She starts with a summary and works her way up to a 4 page paper. Easy A. Just go to class. She will help if you ask.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. B was an amazing teacher! Yes you have to write in her class but its composition what else did you expect. There is always the option for revisions to bring up a bad paper grade and she starts with only a half page and works up from there so you are comfortable in your writing abilities.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: I would choose this professor every time. I am not good at writing and she gives feedback and lets you revise every paper. You cant go wrong, just have to do the work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Mrs. Blanchard is a great professor. Every paper you write she gives you the opportunity to revise. If you just use MLA format you will get an A in the class. 100% would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The only reason I can imagine anyone would give Dr Blanchard a bad score would be because they didnt listen to her and they didnt do their assignments. This class is SO easy if you put in the effort and listen to the teacher! If you dont care about school, dont sign up for her. If you do, shell be one of the best decisions you make.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Blanchard clearly lays out what she wants from you on your papers (extremely detailed in her directions), offers revisions on each paper, and has days in class specifically to work on your paper and ask her anything you need to... she is one of the most caring professors Ive ever had. Know MLA and listen to her and youll do great!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Inspirational

comment: Dr Blanchard is one of the most willing-to-help professors. If you are willing to put in the work, she is willing to help you in any way she can. She is hilarious, kind, and devoted to being an amazing English professor. I strongly urge you to consider taking her! You will not regret it
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Inspirational

comment: Dr. B is awesome! Her class greatly improved my writing. I see a lot of people on here commenting on how she grades really hard, and they are right. She is a hard grader. You won't be able to B.S. your way through her class; you will actually have to work. This is especially true of MLA formatting. She takes it seriously (as she should).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: DrBlanchard is the best English teacher Ive ever had! I had her as a teacher my freshman year of HighSchool and then again my freshman year of college. She really cares about her students. She takes grading papers very seriously. If you cite anything wrong its an automatic 0% and it HAS to be in MLA format or you get points taken off for that too
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Dr. Blanchard is an amazing professor - I wish I could take her for all of my English classes! She gives you multiple chances to revise your papers and earn points back, reminds you constantly of assignment due dates, and is genuinely caring. She can seem rude at times - but it's just her humor and she's honestly a lovely teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She grades our essays solely on MLA. If you have one thing wrong with your MLA format she will take off twenty points.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Best teacher I've had in college!!! Dr. B is the best! Work hard and know your MLA and you will do great.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is ridiculous with how much points she takes off for MLA format... 20 points yeah you read that right. I got a 79 on my paper just because I messed up a tiny part on my citation. I'm telling you she doesn't read the papers for content she only cares about if you're using mla format correctly
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Your overall graded includes 5 papers, a research poster, group project, and multiple reading assignments. She is a tough grader on the papers, and will take off 10 points for having a minor mistake on the works cited page. She is very helpful, however, so just ask questions after class. She also allowed two paper revisions which helped a lot.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Dr. Blanchard certainly makes you work for your grade. Her instructions for the papers are not always lucid, but if you are a good writer you should be fine. Also, you MUST learn proper MLA Version 8 citation methods, otherwise you will struggle to get A's. Be sure to ask for help during or after class if you have trouble.

She is a tough grader and takes off a lot of points on the works cited page. She did not prepare us for the essay and just typed up what the essay was about, not what to include. She gave us a lot of papers in littler time to complete them.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is a very tough grader and you have very few grades. She can be very blunt and a occasionally rude. Tends to ramble a lot. I made all A's in my 1101 class and now I struggle to make B's and C's in this class. Not a lot of work outside of class, gives you time to work on essays in class occasionally.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: It would be great if she works more with the student, not everybody knows everything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Dr. Blanchard makes this course more difficult than it should be. Her grading is more focused on format than content. I have always been a great writer but never got above a B on a paper due to missing small things on my works cited page. She automatically takes 10 points off if the works cited isn't correct. I would not recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: AB is a nice lady that gives 4 papers and a in class final of a rhetorical analysis over a speech. She grades tough on essays but go to writing center and go to class. I got an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She only gives 5 essays and if you don't know what you're doing the first go-around, it's very difficult to bring your grade up from there. Not very focused on content, mostly just the format. You'll lose huge points for it. Definitely a strange transition from English teachers who are so content focused.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Important to go to class. Some days are just working alone out of the textbook. Easy in class work. Some droning lectures. You get 3 days to skip or a letter grade comes off overall grade. Tough paper grader, however easy if you follow ALL formatting. Easy class to pass, just do the work and write a good paper.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Good: 1) Not many papers to write. 2) Little textbook use.  Bad: Work cited age all or nothing. When everyone in the class misses it (except one person), there's a problem. She tells you to go to the writing center. She should do a better job of teaching this. 2)Was indecisive once or twice.  Not too bad, can make a B with moderate effort. ggnore
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took the intro version of this class at a different college. I don't know if she teaches how to pass this class in that class, but if I didn't already know what to do I wouldn't have passed this class. There are no lectures, only five papers. She is a stereotype of college english professors. I don't know if you'll get better, but I'm displeased.

Spends most of class discussing personal matters and how "gracious" she is. Yells at us for making writing mistakes but doesn't teach us how to fix them. Lets her personal lifestress affect her grading. Checks email only on the mornings of class days. Talks down at students. Makes rude remarks if you ask a question. Feedback is vaguenot helpful.
Don't take her..!

Very peculiar grading on essays, will pick at any little detail. Interesting grading concept though, allows students to turn in an essay early and receive a 're-write' to make up to 10% of the original grade. Take advantage of the re-writes if you want to receive a high grade. Waits until after the drop date to start the real work.

LOTS of reading. Her tests are in class essays, handwritten, MLA format!!! You better be a good writer if you take her class. Tough grader. She assigns a novel to read on top of the regular reading assignments. She will stay "if you don't have time for this class, drop out" and you should.

Dr. B is THE BOMB. She is so nice and genuinely cares for her students. All work is pretty simple and she grades very easily. Honestly, the class was a breeze and I suck at English. Wrote my papers the night before they were due, and got A's on every one. She's a fun professor, just do your part and you will be fine!
Good teacher but a lot of work. She is not very clear when it comes to explaining how she wants her papers done.

She was very clear in her guidelines for the class, course content and expectations. She recommended numerous times for some students to go to the free writing center for help, but few  did. If you made a bad grade, you did not show up, did not try or needed to get more help next time.

As long as you read the chapters and write on topics you enjoy then things should be a breeze. she give re-writes and allows you to make up missed class work. She's  willing to help and answer any questions you have. She'e very passionate about her job and wants to see you succeed!

She's hard to read. Some days she is very friendly, but you can tell she lets her stress effect her work. Most of the class is spent talking about the schedule. Also, she lets out early often. If you are a strong writer, you will be fine...just hope you have patience.

She can be rude at times, especially when she goes around to have her "conferences" with you. If you say something she finds unintelligent she will cut you off and let you know. She assigns frequent papers but they are doable. She gives you a rewrite and gives up to 10 points added-very helpful. Quizzes are not hard but you better do your reading!!

She is rude, unclear, and seems like she doesnt care if you pass or not. She also teaches like a highschool teacher. She gives out an essay and doesnt really explain the "how" so you can get the assignment done. She grades VERY hard and nitpicks your whole paper. She gives a rewrite but its useless. I would NOT recommend her to anyone!

Don't take her. She is a terrible teacher. Not very helpful, more criticizing. She was cool the first few days but when ADD/DROP ended showed her true side. She expected us to be able to write a perfect paper based solely on her rubric. She is a very harsh grader, in my class in my class the highest grade on a paper was an 81, with the rewrites.

Dr.Blanchard is the hardest english teach i have taken. The average grade is about a C. She does give rewrites but you are only able to earn a few points back, so its not worht it. Her grading is extremely hard compared to others.  I would not take her if you are going to slack

She really isn't a very nice person AT ALL! I got a C on a in class assignment and she put no explanation on the paper so I asked and she said and I quote "I am not going to go over every little point on every little assignment I'm just not." VERY sarcastic and rude She grades hard and won't explain why...I would DEF. avoid her.

Being able to participate in Professor Blanchard's class not only provided me with a much greater understanding of the effective modes of persuasive writing, but also developed my skills as a writer. Professor Blanchard is both helpful and passionate about the topics she discusses in class. Great feedback and energetic discussions.

Pick something you are interested in for your essays and you will dominate this class. Proper language, use of grammar and MLA documentation is a must! Do not sit in her class and stare at the wall or text - she will destroy you. She's a good teacher, I would recommend for students who do not mind putting effort into their classes.
She's alright. It's a pretty easy class. I did like how you can revise all your papers and she will give you points back. I wouldn't suggest her, but I wouldn't say you shouldn't take her.

Typical English class but you can revise paper if turned in on time.  If not, you get an extra week but no revision.  Really helps top off learning process.  Not easy and not hard.  she hates when students goof off and are tardy.  Mandatory attendance.  Clear about what she wants in a paper and  gives sample essays.  Follow them and youll be fine.

I really liked Dr. Blanchard.  She is very lenient about essays and she gives several chances to revise your papers.  I learned a lot from her class.  We often worked in small groups, which was fun.  I never dreaded coming to her class.  I would definitely recommend her, especially if you like to write (like me).

She is a good teacher. If you turn the papers in on time and pay attention in class you will do fine. Though you do need to pay attention to the syllabus or you will have quiz you don't know about. She a hard grader on your papers too.

This class is hard. She has a pretty lax deadline policy, but it doesn't really matter because you will probably get a C or lower anyways. She is an absolute MLA nazi, and grades like she is teaching a level 3 course. Her quizzes are pretty easy and she's informative but after working hard on a paper and getting a C, that doesn't really matter.
